title: High ping when playing ranked (unplayable), but not in customs
body: Ran into something really strange today, loaded into a ranked game and experienced very high ping (200+), leading to the game eventually becoming totally unresponsive. After the loss, I tested my ping in a custom, which showed the regular 15, and proceeded to load into another ranked, and ran into the same problem again. I'm baffled as to why this is happening, and I have not experienced slower connection in any other application and games (Chrome, Overwatch, etc.). At this point I'm not going to start up another game, but I am still able to login and create custom games with low ping with no problems. Help would be greatly appreciated.

replies.body:
It sounds like your connection to that *specific* server could be encountering issues along the route it takes. We can definitely take a look at your route, but first, we need to ensure your local network settings aren't interfering with your route. Refer to our [connection troubleshooting guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) for a comprehensive list of common solutions for these types of issues.

Let me know if those steps resolved or caused any changed in your connection to Ranked matches.

Local network settings have not been altered recently, I have played with current settings in the recent past with no problems. I've cleared DNS and cache. Is there anyway I can test connection without actually risking another loss and ban? Pinging the server in question perhaps?

You can test your connection to the server by running a traceroute in the windows command prompt with [our guide.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq2)

Feel free to paste the results here so we can take a look.
The support site seems to be down atm, I ran a tracert to what I think are the servers in question, and got this: http://puu.sh/qWRUh/ca84ef235d.png

That's close, but not quite the server we use. I'll instead recommend running a full traceroute with [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/) and the IP 104.160.131.1

Run a trace for 5 minutes, then export the results as text. You'll then be able to paste the text results here.

I'm having the same issue. It only happens at night, but just like you it's in Ranked only. The last time it happened my ping was 250~, but the Normal game before and the Normal game after were at the regular 50~ ping. I tried checking my internet speed during the Ranked match, but it was fine.

It has been happening for about a week now, so I hope that it is something that can be fixed soon. I play mostly ranked so the threat of a randomly appearing unavoidable loss isn't very fun.
Is this an intermittent issue for you? I played a ranked last night and it went without a hitch, I've only encountered it today.

It happens seemingly at random, only ever in Ranked though. Sometimes it will happen twice in one day, sometimes I never come across it. The post about the connection with a specific server being a problem makes a lot of sense.
